CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 24, 1945, pg. 1, reads: "Illusion Baffled Iowa St. Drivers - Optical Illusion Fools Drivers - In the past month, three serious accidents have occurred at the junction of Iowa Street and Ewart Drive.  Drivers contend that they are fooled by and optical illusion at the end of Iowa Street and where Ewart Drive begins.  Allequippa Street looms before them as they approach the end of Iowa, but there is a deep ravine and Centre Avenue between Iowa and Allequippa.  At left, arrow points to where automobiles have been crashing.  Jotted arrow points to the curve they should take.  The white X shows Allequippa Street - and the illusion... - Courier Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Iowa Street before Ewart Drive, with stone fence on left, Hill District
